page.title: 12TYTHERINGTON CHURCHES
page.content: There are two churches in{Tytherington -{St.James' Church}and the{Baptist {Church. {St. James' Church}is in the centre of the village based on {Tytherington {Hill}against a backdrop of trees. It is on a main road, near a roundabout. It is built in the {Early English}and {Perpendicular}styles. The towers are in a traditional style. The church has been restored over the years, particularly between{1882}and{1884. There is a{war memorial}at the back of the church. There are many people in the village, old and young, who go to church often. In addition many{weddings}and{funerals are held at the church. The other church in{Tytherington,}the{ {Baptist Church,}is not all that old.
